data.text: @moss_sphagnum I'm glad i had over 40 years of decent life before this insanity. See you in hell! We'll all be dead soon.
@ArchoProbato Yes, in our area too, all of those protections will likely drop after Spring break in April. It's so terrible. I am bracing for it too in Vancouver

@moss_sphagnum Yes, she does that too w/ Aranet C02 montior. Personal situ aside, the NYC situation is probably going to go apeshit rapidly because we have no more mask mandates almost any where (technically transit & medical facilities but not enforced) AND abolished vaxx mandates.

@ArchoProbato That is a tough spot to be in. I'm also preparing for mask rules changing. My option can still  be outdoor ed...Every. Single. Day.  But, I do have those early  century #COVIDisAirborne  pandemic windows and a CO2 monitor. If I maintain <600 ppm CO2, wear my N95, it'll help https://t.co/IHiIjAdDvs

@moss_sphagnum My wife teaches at public school with ~1000 staff & students & starting tomorrow she expects that 2/3 of them will not wear masks any more. They have 2-3 cases per week & that will likely skyrocket. But they kept schools open when they had 100s of cases a week in January, so..
@Kaplan4Oakland @BernieDogs4 Well NYC did most of that that too but is now rolling back mask and vaccine mandates, as is much of California. But not Oakland?

@ArchoProbato @BernieDogs4 Locally we have opened more free public vax sites, mandated vaccines in some contexts, promoted and distributed masks, funded educational and outreach programs etc. 

Though official public health directives are under control of County, State and CDC and also need to be stronger.
@ArchoProbato @Kaplan4Oakland I'll let her answer from her position there.
